info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 9:55PM EDT until May 15 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central and northwest Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, Albemarle, Greene and Orange. In northwest Virginia, Madison.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 955 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stanardsville... Free Union... Campbell... Westmoreland... Hollymead... Gordonsville... Ruckersville... Quinque... Newtown... Advance Mills... Eheart... Burtonville... Dawsonville... Stony Point... Amicus... Earlysville... Barboursville... Carrsbrook... Shelby... Rochelle... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Albemarle, VA; Greene, VA; Madison, VA; Orange, VA
